Introduction to ‘caracas’

Source: vignettes/introduction.Rmd
introduction.Rmd
library(caracas)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'caracas'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     %*%

Road-map

Currently only a SymPy object is available. More functionality will be added shortly. Please keep an eye out at the development site at https://github.com/r-cas/caracas.

Notes

  • Python syntax is used, which means that there are a few differences to R’s syntax:
    • Power is ** not ^ (see below)

Quick start

x <- symbol('x')
as.character(x)
#> [1] "x"
x
#> [caracas]: x
as_r(x)
#> expression(x)
2*x
#> [caracas]: 2⋅x
y <- symbol('y')
sqrt(3*x^y)
#> [caracas]:       ____
#>                 ╱  y 
#>            √3⋅╲╱  x
z <- cos(x)^2 + sin(x)^2
z
#> [caracas]:    2         2   
#>            sin (x) + cos (x)
simplify(z)
#> [caracas]: 1
tex(z)
#> [1] "\\sin^{2}{\\left(x \\right)} + \\cos^{2}{\\left(x \\right)}"
z <- cos(x)*cos(y) - sin(x)*sin(y)
z
#> [caracas]: -sin(x)⋅sin(y) + cos(x)⋅cos(y)
simplify(z)
#> [caracas]: cos(x + y)
z <- cos(x + y)
z
#> [caracas]: cos(x + y)
expand(z)
#> [caracas]: cos(x + y)
expand_trig(z)
#> [caracas]: -sin(x)⋅sin(y) + cos(x)⋅cos(y)
x <- symbol('x')
y <- symbol('y')
z <- log(x*y)
z
#> [caracas]: log(x⋅y)
expand_log(z)
#> [caracas]: log(x) + log(y)

Sums

x <- symbol("x")
sumf(1/x, "x", 1, 10)
#> [caracas]: 7381
#>            ────
#>            2520
sumf(1/x, x, 1, 10)
#> [caracas]: 7381
#>            ────
#>            2520
s <- sumf(1/x, "x", 1, 10)
as_r(s)
#> [1] 2.928968
sum(1/(1:10))
#> [1] 2.928968
n <- symbol("n")
simplify(sumf(x, x, 1, n))
#> [caracas]: n⋅(n + 1)
#>            ─────────
#>                2

Products

x <- symbol("x")
p <- prodf(1/x, "x", 1, 10)
p
#> [caracas]: 1/3628800
as_r(p)
#> [1] 2.755732e-07
prod(1/(1:10))
#> [1] 2.755732e-07
n <- symbol("n")
prodf(x, x, 1, n)
#> [caracas]: n!

Integrals

x <- symbol("x")

intf(1/x, x, 1, 10)
#> [caracas]: log(10)
i1 <- intf(1/x, x, 1, 10, doit = FALSE)
i1
#> [caracas]: 10     
#>            ⌠      
#>            ⎮  1   
#>            ⎮  ─ dx
#>            ⎮  x   
#>            ⌡      
#>            1
tex(i1)
#> [1] "\\int\\limits_{1}^{10} \\frac{1}{x}\\, dx"
doit(i1)
#> [caracas]: log(10)
intf(1/x, x)
#> [caracas]: log(x)
i1 <- intf(1/x, x, doit = FALSE)
i1
#> [caracas]: ⌠     
#>            ⎮ 1   
#>            ⎮ ─ dx
#>            ⎮ x   
#>            ⌡
tex(i1)
#> [1] "\\int \\frac{1}{x}\\, dx"
doit(i1)
#> [caracas]: log(x)

Limits

x <- symbol("x")
lim(sin(x)/x, "x", 0)
#> [caracas]: 1
lim(1/x, "x", 0, dir = '+')
#> [caracas]: ∞
lim(1/x, "x", 0, dir = '-')
#> [caracas]: -∞

We can also postpone evaluation:

x <- symbol("x")
lim(sin(x)/x, "x", 0)
#> [caracas]: 1
lim(sin(x)/x, x, 0)
#> [caracas]: 1
res <- lim(sin(x)/x, "x", 0, doit = FALSE)
res
#> [caracas]:      ⎛sin(x)⎞
#>             lim ⎜──────⎟
#>            x─→0⁺⎝  x   ⎠
as.character(res)
#> [1] "Limit(sin(x)/x, x, 0)"
tex(res)
#> [1] "\\lim_{x \\to 0^+}\\left(\\frac{\\sin{\\left(x \\right)}}{x}\\right)"
doit(res)
#> [caracas]: 1
as_r(res)
#> [1] 1

Derivatives

Note that the function is called d() and not deriv().

x <- symbol("x")
y <- symbol("y")
f <- 3*x^2 + x*y^2
f
#> [caracas]:    2      2
#>            3⋅x  + x⋅y
as_r(f)
#> expression(3 * x^2 + x * y^2)
dd(f, "x")
#> [caracas]:        2
#>            6⋅x + y
dd(f, x)
#> [caracas]:        2
#>            6⋅x + y
dd(f, c("x", "y"))
#> [caracas]: ⎡       2       ⎤
#>            ⎣6⋅x + y   2⋅x⋅y⎦
dd(f, c(x, y))
#> [caracas]: ⎡       2       ⎤
#>            ⎣6⋅x + y   2⋅x⋅y⎦
f1 <- dd(f, c(x, y))
f1
#> [caracas]: ⎡       2       ⎤
#>            ⎣6⋅x + y   2⋅x⋅y⎦
as.character(f1)
#> [1] "[6*x + y^2, 2*x*y]"
as_r(f1)
#> expression(cbind(6 * x + y^2, 2 * x * y))
eval(as_r(f1), list(x = 1, y = 2))
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]   10    4
dd(f1, c(x, y))
#> [caracas]: ⎡ 6   2⋅y⎤
#>            ⎢        ⎥
#>            ⎣2⋅y  2⋅x⎦
f2 <- dd2(f, c(x, y))
f2
#> [caracas]: ⎡ 6   2⋅y⎤
#>            ⎢        ⎥
#>            ⎣2⋅y  2⋅x⎦
as_r(f2)
#> expression(rbind(cbind(6, 2 * y), cbind(2 * y, 2 * x)))
eval(as_r(f2), list(x = 1, y = 2))
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]    6    4
#> [2,]    4    2
x <- symbol("x")
y <- symbol("y")
f <- eval_to_symbol("[3*x**2 + x*y**2, 2*x, 5*y]")
f
#> [caracas]: ⎡   2      2          ⎤
#>            ⎣3⋅x  + x⋅y , 2⋅x, 5⋅y⎦
dd(f, c(x, y))
#> [caracas]: ⎡       2      ⎤
#>            ⎢6⋅x + y   2  0⎥
#>            ⎢              ⎥
#>            ⎣ 2⋅x⋅y    0  5⎦

Linear algebra

A <- matrix(c("x", 0, 0, "2*x"), 2, 2)
A
#>      [,1] [,2] 
#> [1,] "x"  "0"  
#> [2,] "0"  "2*x"
B <- as_symbol(A)
B
#> [caracas]: ⎡x   0 ⎤
#>            ⎢      ⎥
#>            ⎣0  2⋅x⎦
2*B
#> [caracas]: ⎡2⋅x   0 ⎤
#>            ⎢        ⎥
#>            ⎣ 0   4⋅x⎦
dim(B)
#> [1] 2 2
sqrt(B)
#> [caracas]: ⎡√x    0  ⎤
#>            ⎢         ⎥
#>            ⎣0   √2⋅√x⎦
log(B)
#> [caracas]: ⎡log(x)    zoo   ⎤
#>            ⎢                ⎥
#>            ⎣ zoo    log(2⋅x)⎦
B %*% t(B)
#> [caracas]: ⎡ 2      ⎤
#>            ⎢x    0  ⎥
#>            ⎢        ⎥
#>            ⎢       2⎥
#>            ⎣0   4⋅x ⎦

Naive Bayes model

Consider this model: \[ x_i = a x_0 + e_i, \quad i=1, \dots, 4 \] and \(x_0=e_0\). All terms \(e_0, \dots, e_3\) are independent and \(N(0,1)\) distributed. Let \(e=(e_0, \dots, e_3)\) and \(x=(x_0, \dots x_3)\). Isolating error terms gives that \[ e = L_1 x \] where \(L_1\) has the form

L1chr <- diag(4)
L1chr[2:4, 1] <- "-a"
L1 <- as_symbol(L1chr)
L1
#> [caracas]: ⎡1   0  0  0⎤
#>            ⎢           ⎥
#>            ⎢-a  1  0  0⎥
#>            ⎢           ⎥
#>            ⎢-a  0  1  0⎥
#>            ⎢           ⎥
#>            ⎣-a  0  0  1⎦

If error terms have variance \(1\) then \(\mathbf{Var}(e)=L \mathbf{Var}(x) L'\) so the covariance matrix is \(V1=\mathbf{Var}(x) = L^- (L^-)'\) while the concentration matrix (the inverse covariances matrix) is \(K=L' L\).

L1inv <- inverse(L1)
K1 <- t(L1) %*% L1
V1 <- L1inv %*% t(L1inv)
cat(
  "\\begin{align} 
    K_1 &= ", tex(K1), " \\\\ 
   V_1 &= ", tex(V1), " 
  \\end{align}", sep = "")

\[\begin{align} K_1 &= \left[\begin{matrix}3 a^{2} + 1 & - a & - a & - a\\- a & 1 & 0 & 0\\- a & 0 & 1 & 0\\- a & 0 & 0 & 1\end{matrix}\right] \\ V_1 &= \left[\begin{matrix}1 & a & a & a\\a & a^{2} + 1 & a^{2} & a^{2}\\a & a^{2} & a^{2} + 1 & a^{2}\\a & a^{2} & a^{2} & a^{2} + 1\end{matrix}\right] \end{align}\]

Slightly more elaborate:

L2chr <- diag(4)
L2chr[2:4, 1] <- c("-a1", "-a2", "-a3")
L2 <- as_symbol(L2chr)
L2
#> [caracas]: ⎡ 1   0  0  0⎤
#>            ⎢            ⎥
#>            ⎢-a₁  1  0  0⎥
#>            ⎢            ⎥
#>            ⎢-a₂  0  1  0⎥
#>            ⎢            ⎥
#>            ⎣-a₃  0  0  1⎦
Vechr <- diag(4)
Vechr[cbind(1:4, 1:4)] <- c("w1", "w2", "w2", "w2")
Ve <- as_symbol(Vechr)
Ve
#> [caracas]: ⎡w₁  0   0   0 ⎤
#>            ⎢              ⎥
#>            ⎢0   w₂  0   0 ⎥
#>            ⎢              ⎥
#>            ⎢0   0   w₂  0 ⎥
#>            ⎢              ⎥
#>            ⎣0   0   0   w₂⎦
L2inv <- inverse(L2)
K2 <- t(L2) %*% inverse(Ve) %*% L2
V2 <- L2inv %*% Ve %*% t(L2inv)
cat(
  "\\begin{align} 
    K_2 &= ", tex(K2), " \\\\ 
   V_2 &= ", tex(V2), " 
  \\end{align}", sep = "")

\[\begin{align} K_2 &= \left[\begin{matrix}\frac{a_{1}^{2}}{w_{2}} + \frac{a_{2}^{2}}{w_{2}} + \frac{a_{3}^{2}}{w_{2}} + \frac{1}{w_{1}} & - \frac{a_{1}}{w_{2}} & - \frac{a_{2}}{w_{2}} & - \frac{a_{3}}{w_{2}}\\- \frac{a_{1}}{w_{2}} & \frac{1}{w_{2}} & 0 & 0\\- \frac{a_{2}}{w_{2}} & 0 & \frac{1}{w_{2}} & 0\\- \frac{a_{3}}{w_{2}} & 0 & 0 & \frac{1}{w_{2}}\end{matrix}\right] \\ V_2 &= \left[\begin{matrix}w_{1} & a_{1} w_{1} & a_{2} w_{1} & a_{3} w_{1}\\a_{1} w_{1} & a_{1}^{2} w_{1} + w_{2} & a_{1} a_{2} w_{1} & a_{1} a_{3} w_{1}\\a_{2} w_{1} & a_{1} a_{2} w_{1} & a_{2}^{2} w_{1} + w_{2} & a_{2} a_{3} w_{1}\\a_{3} w_{1} & a_{1} a_{3} w_{1} & a_{2} a_{3} w_{1} & a_{3}^{2} w_{1} + w_{2}\end{matrix}\right] \end{align}\]

Solve

  • inverse()
  • linsolve()
  • rootsolve()
  • systemsolve()
# Multinomial likelihood
p <- as_symbol(paste0("p", 1:3))
y <- as_symbol(paste0("y", 1:3))
a <- as_symbol("a")
l <- sum(y*log(p))
l
#> [caracas]: y₁⋅log(p₁) + y₂⋅log(p₂) + y₃⋅log(p₃)
L <- -l + a*(sum(p) - 1)
L
#> [caracas]: a⋅(p₁ + p₂ + p₃ - 1) - y₁⋅log(p₁) - y₂⋅log(p₂) - y₃⋅log(p₃)
tex(L)
#> [1] "a \\left(p_{1} + p_{2} + p_{3} - 1\\right) - y_{1} \\log{\\left(p_{1} \\right)} - y_{2} \\log{\\left(p_{2} \\right)} - y_{3} \\log{\\left(p_{3} \\right)}"
g <- dd(L, c("a", paste0("p", 1:3)))
g
#> [caracas]: ⎡                      y₁      y₂      y₃⎤
#>            ⎢p₁ + p₂ + p₃ - 1  a - ──  a - ──  a - ──⎥
#>            ⎣                      p₁      p₂      p₃⎦
sol <- rootsolve(g, c("p1", "p2", "p3", "a"))
sol
#> [[1]]
#> [[1]]$p1
#> [caracas]:      y₁     
#>            ────────────
#>            y₁ + y₂ + y₃
#> 
#> [[1]]$p2
#> [caracas]:      y₂     
#>            ────────────
#>            y₁ + y₂ + y₃
#> 
#> [[1]]$p3
#> [caracas]:      y₃     
#>            ────────────
#>            y₁ + y₂ + y₃
#> 
#> [[1]]$a
#> [caracas]: y₁ + y₂ + y₃
tex(sol[[1L]]$p1)
#> [1] "\\frac{y_{1}}{y_{1} + y_{2} + y_{3}}"

Using SymPy directly

sympy <- get_sympy()
sympy$diff("2*a*x", "x")
#> 2*a
sympy$solve("x**2 - 1", "x")
#> [[1]]
#> -1
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> 1

Please find more examples in the other vignettes.
